Node.definition: = town; ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► ancestral town of King David (דָּוִד)
= town, also known as Ephrath (אֶפְרָת) and Bethlehem (בֵּית לֶחֶם) ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► location where Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) buried his wife Rachel (רָחֵל)
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= group of interrelated families

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.gloss: to come out of (a group)|to be one of a group
Node.definition: literally: to come out (of a group); hence: = process by which humans are a member of a certain community

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: goings out; hence: = a reference to the moment that someone's family line begins
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= process by which humans or deities increase in status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

Node.gloss: ends of the earth > all people on earth
Node.definition: literally: ends of the earth; hence: = all people on earth, including those living in its remotest corners

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to tread|to set foot (on something)|to march|to move
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= state in which a countable entity is eight in number
= person in a position of authority over a nation or tribe
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans or deities cause individuals and nations to come to ruin in a violent way

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= man; ◄ son of Cush (כּוּשׁ) descendant of Ham (חָם) ► considered the first mighty warrior on earth and the founder and ruler of several of the great cities of old

= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth|literally: opened sword; hence: = sword (חֶרֶב) that has been removed from its scabbard ► in order to harm someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to tread|to set foot (on something)|to march|to move
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a brief and usually light fall of rain; ≈ regarded as a blessing
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to tear to pieces|to maul|to mangle
Node.definition: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
literally: (one's) (right) hand is raised; hence: = state in which humans or deities are victorious in battle
literally: (to do something with) raised hand; hence: = state in which humans or deities perform an action with confidence
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security
literally: to cut off (an event); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to stop happening
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to practice soothsaying, divination|to tell fortunes, the future
Node.definition: = action by which someone foretells future events by using magic, casting spells, or conjuring up spirits; forbidden by the Law of Moses
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= a column ◄ that was usually made of a single stone; with or without inscriptions, ► as an attribute relating to non sanctioned worship, usually found on a high place (בָּמָה)
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= a pole, ◄ made of wood, ► representing the deity Ashera, and set up near the altar in a place of sacrifice

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
